content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. The coach of an American football program at a large university believes that the number of bench press repetitions (reps) with <math alttext="225" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds that the <math alttext="350" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>350</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> athletes in the program are able to complete, on average, is different from <math alttext="28" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>28</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. A random sample of <math alttext="32" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> athletes from the program were surveyed with the following question. How many bench press reps can you usually complete with <math alttext="225" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds? From the <math alttext="32" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> respondents, the coach obtained a one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval to estimate <math alttext="mu sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, the mean number of bench press reps that all athletes in the program can complete with <math alttext="225" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds. Assume the conditions for inference have been met. At the <math alttext="98" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>98</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent confidence level, the interval was <math alttext="33.065 plus or minus 3.335" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>33.065</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>3.335</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Does the confidence interval support the coach’s belief that the number of bench press reps with <math alttext="225" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds that all athletes in the program are able to complete, on average, is different from <math alttext="28" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>28</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>? Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. The coach of an American football program at a large university believes that the number of bench press repetitions (reps) with <math alttext="225" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds that the <math alttext="350" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>350</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> athletes in the program are able to complete, on average, is different from <math alttext="28" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>28</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. A random sample of <math alttext="32" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> athletes from the program were surveyed with the following question. How many bench press reps can you usually complete with <math alttext="225" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds? From the <math alttext="32" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> respondents, the coach obtained a one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval to estimate <math alttext="mu sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, the mean number of bench press reps that all athletes in the program can complete with <math alttext="225" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds. Assume the conditions for inference have been met. At the <math alttext="98" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>98</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent confidence level, the interval was <math alttext="33.065 plus or minus 3.335" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>33.065</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>3.335</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Does the confidence interval support the coach’s belief that the number of bench press reps with <math alttext="225" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds that all athletes in the program are able to complete, on average, is different from <math alttext="28" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>28</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>? Justify your answer.

Upon further investigation, the coach thinks that athletes who play a defensive position may respond differently to the survey than athletes who play an offensive position. The coach plans to conduct a new survey using independent random samples of athletes who play a defensive position and athletes who play an offensive position. Assume that there are approximately equal numbers of athletes who play a defensive position and athletes who play an offensive position, and that no athlete plays both a defensive and an offensive position.(b) Describe a method that the coach could use to obtain two independent random samples, one of <math alttext="14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> athletes who play a defensive position and one of <math alttext="16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> athletes who play an offensive position, from the <math alttext="350" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>350</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> athletes in the program.

(c) The coach wants to use an inference procedure to determine whether the sample data provide convincing statistical evidence of a difference in the population mean numbers of bench press reps the athletes would be able to complete with <math alttext="225" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds for those who play a defensive position and those who play an offensive position. Explain whether each condition for inference is met.

The coach decided to also ask each athlete in the new survey to report their body weight, in pounds. The scatterplot below shows the data for each of the athletes in the two samples. (d) Describe what the scatterplot reveals about the relationship between body weight and number of bench press reps with <math alttext="225" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds for each of the following: the <math alttext="14" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> athletes who play a defensive position and the <math alttext="16" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> athletes who play an offensive position.

A scatterplot of only the <math alttext="16" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> athletes who play an offensive position is shown, along with regression output for a linear model using body weight to predict number of bench press reps with <math alttext="225" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds. (e) Describe the impact on the slope of the least-squares regression line and the coefficient of determination, <math alttext="r squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, if an athlete who reported a body weight of <math alttext="315" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>315</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds and <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> bench press reps with <math alttext="225" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds was added to the data. Explain your answer.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Describe an appropriate method for gathering and representing data.
